en: There is an urgent message for you.
I don't have the authority to give you the green light.
I have urgent business with you.
He won't do you any harm.
Here's to you!
I'd like for you to go.
I never see you without thinking of my father.
tr: Seni gördüğümde hep babam aklıma gelir.

en: I am very glad to see you.
It was very nice seeing you again.
It's great to meet you.
Every time I see you, I think of your father.
tr: Seni her gördüğümde baban aklıma gelir.

en: Whenever I see you, I feel happy.
I never see you without thinking of my mother.
tr: Seni ne zaman görsem annem aklıma gelir.

en: A Mr Ono called to see you.
There is a man at the door who wants to see you.
tr: Kapıda sizi görmek isteyen bir adam var.

en: There's an American girl who wants to see you.
tr: Sizi görmek isteyen Amerikalı bir kız var.

en: There is a gentleman to see you.
tr: Sizi görmek isteyen bir bey var.

en: A man who wanted to see you came while you were out.
tr: Siz yokken sizi görmek isteyen biri geldi.

en: There's somebody who wants to meet you.
I'd rather you stayed at home.
I will show you some pictures.
Shall I give you something to read?
tr: Sana okuyacak bir şeyler vereyim mi?

en: Let me get you something to drink.
I keep nothing from you.
I'd like to give you a piece of advice.
I have no secrets from you.
I fancy we've met before.
I have good news for you.
What takes you only three days, takes me as many weeks.
tr: Senin üç günde hallettiğin şey, benim üç haftamı buluyor.

en: I hope you won't mind if I give you some advice.
tr: Sana bir tavsiye versem alınmazsın, değil mi?

en: You have a large family to support; don't play for high stakes.
tr: Bakman gereken kocaman bir ailen var; yüksekten oynama.

en: You heard from him?
You can't imagine it, can you?
You have two brothers.
You'll be told in advance.
I have never clapped eyes on you before.
You have the right to the truth.
I cannot agree with you.
It may seem trivial to you, but for me it's worth paying attention to.
tr: Sana önemsiz gelebilir ama benim için dikkat etmeye değer.

en: I would have you apply yourself to your studies.
Do you have any brothers?
You may be able to read the handwriting on the wall, but it is Greek to me.
tr: Sen duvardaki yazıyı okuyabilirsin belki ama benim için o Çince.

en: Maybe you don't know this, but nobody could ever take your place.
tr: Belki bunu bilmiyorsun ama kimse senin yerini tutamaz.

en: You have a sense of humor.
I should have told you everything earlier.
tr: Sana her şeyi daha önce söylemeliydim.

en: Should I have asked you first?
I have a great esteem for you.
Do you have many hobbies?
You have no right to go there.
I am ready to do anything that I can for you, because I owe you a great deal.
tr: Senin için elimden geleni yapmaya hazırım çünkü sana çok şey borçluyum.

en: I cannot lend this book to you.
You'll be in charge of the girls working in this factory.
tr: Bu fabrikadaki kızlardan sen sorumlu olacaksın.

en: Remember I will always be at your back.
It looks very good on you.
Choose friends you can rely on.
When will it be convenient for you?
I will give you the money.
I shall let you see that.
I had hoped to meet you there.
I'll leave everything to you.
This is all I can do for you.
I'd like you to read this book.
I'd like you to translate this book into English.
I can't lend you this book.
I am looking forward to seeing you in this town.
tr: Bu kasabada seni görmeyi sabırsızlıkla bekliyorum.

en: You are the last person I would have expected to see here.
tr: Burada görmeyi umduğum son kişi sendin.

en: I am glad to run into you here.
I have something good to tell you.
There is a lady downstairs who wants to speak to you.
tr: Aşağıda seninle konuşmak isteyen bir hanım var.

en: I would like to tell you something.
It was a pleasure meeting you, Mr Tamori.
I'm happy to see you.
I think he will be glad to see you.
I would like you to make tea for me.
Can I ask you a favor?
It is a privilege to meet you.
I am delighted to meet you.
I'm very glad to meet you.
It was nice to meet you, and I look forward to hearing from you.
I'm surprised to see you.
There is a woman who wants to see you.
tr: Seni görmek isteyen bir kadın var.

en: We enjoyed having you as our guest.
How much we pay you depends on your skill.
tr: Sana ne kadar ödeyeceğimiz yeteneğine bağlı.

en: I have something to give you.
I want you to be an Einstein.
I would like you to meet my parents.
We're confident that you are up to the challenge of the new position.
Since it is you, I have confidence you can solve it.
I just asked because I thought you would know.
What do you figure on this?
Who is it that you want to talk to?
There's something I need to talk with you about.
tr: Seninle konuşmam gereken bir şey var.

en: I look forward to corresponding with you.
Is there any difference between your idea and hers?
tr: Senin fikrinle onunkinin arasında bir fark var mı?

en: I am no more an artist than you are.
tr: Ben de senin gibi bir sanatçı değilim.

en: You and he are both very kind.
tr: Sen de o da çok naziksiniz.

en: I quite agree with you.
Let me exchange seats with you.
I will discuss the question with you in detail.
I would like to have a word with you.
tr: Seninle bir iki laf etmek istiyorum.

en: I make you a deal.
You and I must give him our present.
You and I are men.
You and I are old friends.
You and I are good partners in business.
You and I have succeeded in our attempt.
You and I must understand one another, and that without delay.
tr: Seninle ben hiç gecikmeden birbirimizi anlamalıyız.

en: Both you and I must take care of the dog.
tr: Köpeğe sen de ben de bakmalıyız.

en: Your problem and mine are similar.
Between you and me, Lisa, we know that I simply don't like Nick.
tr: Aramızda kalsın Lisa, Nick'i hiç sevmediğimi biliyoruz.

en: There is no time like the time when you and I were young.
tr: Seninle ben gençkenki zaman gibisi yok.

en: Do you remember the day when you and I first met?
tr: Seninle ilk tanıştığımız günü hatırlıyor musun?

en: It was a great privilege working with you.
tr: Seninle çalışmak benim için büyük bir ayrıcalıktı.

en: Having worked with you was a real treat for me.
tr: Seninle çalışmak benim için gerçek bir keyifti.

en: I enjoyed your company.
Who is taller, you or Ken?
tr: Sen mi Ken mi daha uzunsun?

en: It is no good arguing with you.
Never have I dreamed of marrying you.
I might as well marry a bird as marry you.
tr: Seninle evleneceğime bir kuşla evlensem daha iyi.

en: I mistook you for your brother.
It is useless even if I discuss with you.
I liked you even more when I met you.
tr: Seninle tanışınca seni daha da çok sevdim.

en: I'm very pleased to come with you.
Had I better go with you?
tr: Seninle gitsem daha iyi olur mu?

en: It's a lot of fun to be with you.
I really enjoyed your company.
tr: Seninle olmaktan gerçekten çok keyif aldım.

en: I'm the one who wants to be with you.
I enjoyed your company very much.
I want to make love with you.
I identify with you.
It seems that I met you somewhere.
I'm afraid I differ with you on this point.
tr: Bu konuda maalesef seninle aynı fikirde değilim.

en: I'd like to have a word with you.
I have something to talk over with you, face to face.
tr: Seninle yüz yüze konuşacak bir şeyim var.

en: How long have you and Jane been married?
tr: Sen ve Jane ne kadar süredir evlisiniz?

en: I'm glad for this opportunity to work with you.
tr: Seninle çalışma fırsatı bulduğum için çok memnunum.

en: Nice talking with you.
I enjoyed talking with you.
May I talk with you?
May I have a talk with you?
Being with you makes me feel happy.
I will come with you.
You and your friends are invited.
You're a life saver.
You're so set in your ways!
You're such a pack rat.
You're a wonderful guy.
How would you deal with the problem?
You young people have no sense of humor at all.
tr: Siz gençlerde hiç mizah anlayışı yok.

en: I remember seeing you all somewhere.
You must not look down on old people.
Are you students?
Do you walk hand in hand?
You are all our guests tonight.
You can go there in a boat.
You are both in the wrong.
Who is going to play the part in your play?
May you have a very happy married life!
tr: Çok mutlu bir evlilik hayatınız olsun!

en: Have you met each other?
Not only you but also he is in the wrong.
tr: Sadece sen değil, o da haksız.

en: I imagine you're not the only one, Mr Bark.
tr: Sanırım tek siz değilsiniz, Bay Bark.

en: You alone are my hope.
You are my only resort.
You're the only one who can help me.
tr: Bana yardım edebilecek tek kişi sensin.

en: It's OK with me if it's OK with you.
You are the very person I have been looking for.
People of your age often have this problem.
tr: Sizin yaşınızdaki insanlar sık sık bu sorunu yaşar.

en: Who is the man that you were talking with?
Are you aware of the fact that you are not spoken well of?
I've never seen you cook. Can you cook anything at all?
tr: Seni hiç yemek yaparken görmedim. Hiç yemek yapmayı biliyor musun?

en: You were seen to cook.
If you are to be a good world citizen, you should try to be free of any prejudices.
tr: İyi bir dünya vatandaşı olacaksanız, ön yargılardan arınmaya çalışmalısınız.

en: Please phone me when you have settled down.
She will come if you ask her.
I'll lend you the book, provided you return it next week.
tr: Kitabı sana veririm, haftaya geri getirirsen.

en: I will go if you come.
Tell me the time when you will come.
I'll be so glad if you can come.
Let me know the days when you can come.
I'm glad that you'll come.
They were disappointed that you could not come.
It is a pity you cannot come.
I'm glad you could come. Please make yourself at home.
I'm glad you could come.
I am looking forward to meeting you when you come.
tr: Geldiğinizde sizinle tanışmayı dört gözle bekliyorum.

en: If you care to come, you will be welcome.
What was it that you wanted?
I'll get you whatever you want.
Take as many as you want.
Your encouragement will draw her out.
I can't blame you for breaking your promise.
Your father will lose face if you don't keep your promise.
May you return home safe!
What is it that you really want to say?
While you are reading to me, I can do my sewing.
tr: Sen bana okurken ben de dikiş yapabilirim.

en: I know that you are busy.
I know how busy you must be, but I need your answer to my last email before I can proceed with the project. Can you take a moment and write me back?
tr: Ne kadar meşgul olduğunuzu biliyorum ama projeye devam etmeden önce son e-postama cevabınıza ihtiyacım var. Bir dakikanızı ayırıp bana geri yazabilir misiniz?

en: You came out of the room.
What was the music you were listening to?
Who will look after your cat while you are away?
If I had known about your illness, I would have visited you in the hospital.
It is surprising that you should know her name.
It was sensible of you to follow her advice.
I can't imagine your not knowing her address.
It is strange that you should know nothing about her wedding.
tr: Onun düğünü hakkında hiçbir şey bilmemen çok garip.

en: You might well ask her why she dislikes you.
tr: Seni neden sevmediğini ona sorsan iyi edersin.

en: You will do well to leave her.
I wouldn't object if you wanted to go with her.
I am surprised that you should not know of their marriage.
You can be sure that the money you give them will be put to good use.
tr: Onlara verdiğin paranın boşa gitmeyeceğinden emin olabilirsin.

en: He will be sleeping when you get to his house.
tr: Sen onun evine vardığında uyuyor olacak.

en: You can tell him for all I care.
It's no use your begging him for help.
Judging from what you have seen of him, this fellow is not a coward.
tr: Onu gördüğün kadarıyla bu adam korkak değil.

en: I will never force you to marry him.
For all you say about him, I still like him.
tr: Onun hakkında ne söylersen söyle, onu hala seviyorum.

en: He will go swimming, whether you go with him or stay at home.
tr: Sen onunla gitsen de evde kalsan da o yüzmeye gidecek.

en: Will you show me what you bought?
The camera that you bought is better than mine.
It's your deal.
I'll look after the children while you go shopping.
tr: Sen alışverişe giderken çocuklara ben bakarım.

en: If you act like a fool, you must be treated as such.
tr: Aptal gibi davranırsan, aptal muamelesi görürsün.

en: I will take care of you when you are old.
I will badly miss you if you leave Japan.
I thought you were Japanese.
While you are about it, please make a cup of coffee for me, too.
tr: Hazır elin değmişken, bana da bir kahve yapar mısın?

en: We will miss you terribly if you leave Japan.
Was he still here when you arrived?
tr: Sen geldiğinde o hala burada mıydı?

en: Prior to your arrival, he left for London.
There is nothing for you to be angry about.
It is natural that you should get angry.
I was disappointed that you didn't call.
I was taking a bath when you called me.
You don't have to be discouraged because you are not a genius.
tr: Dahi değilsin diye moralini bozmana gerek yok.

en: Read whatever books you think proper.
It is no use your resisting.
I saw you making eyes at Mr Nagashima.
Give up smoking if you want to live long.
Please visit as soon as you get into town.
She was astonished that you spoke Chinese so well.
tr: Çinceyi bu kadar iyi konuşmana çok şaşırdı.

en: I know that boy whom you don't know.
tr: Senin tanımadığın o çocuğu ben tanıyorum.

en: You must remember to tell him all that you know.
tr: Bildiğin her şeyi ona söylemeyi unutma.

en: Let's look at the path that you've walked so far.
tr: Şimdiye kadar yürüdüğün yola bir bakalım.

en: It's a better line than when you used to call me from the university.
tr: Üniversiteden beni aradığın zamankinden daha iyi bir hat.

en: When you dislike others, you are disliked by them in turn.
tr: Başkalarını sevmezsen, onlar da seni sevmez.

en: We are hoping for your quick recovery.
That you have come early is a good thing.
If you concentrate all your energies on the study of English, you will master the language.
tr: Tüm enerjini İngilizce öğrenmeye yoğunlaştırırsan, dili öğrenirsin.

en: It's all the same to me whether you will go to sea or not.
tr: Denize gitsen de gitmesen de benim için fark etmez.

en: I'll leave a key with my next-door neighbour in case you get here before I do.
tr: Benden önce gelirsen kapı komşuma bir anahtar bırakırım.

en: I don't think there is any need for you to explain.
Listen to those whom you think to be honest.
Granting that you are honest, that is no proof of your innocence.
tr: Dürüst olduğunu kabul etsek bile, bu senin masum olduğunu kanıtlamaz.

en: It has dawned upon my mind that you are in the right.
By the time you land at Narita, it will be dark.
I am pleased at your success.
Is there any place you recommend?
tr: Tavsiye ettiğin bir yer var mı?

en: Whom do you respect most in your life?
tr: Hayatında en çok kime saygı duyarsın?

en: A woman visited us while you were sleeping.
tr: Sen uyurken bir kadın bizi ziyaret etti.

en: Food you eat that you don't like will not be digested well.
He would have failed in his business but that you helped him.
If it had not been for your help, I should have drowned.
Without your help, I would have been unable to do it.
We will keep it for you until you leave.
tr: Sen gidene kadar onu sana saklayacağız.

en: I want to see you before you go.
Please be careful not to forget to lock the door when you go out.
Your help will save us a lot of work.
If you will help me, we will soon finish.
If you help me, I'll try it again.
What's the name of the man whose car you borrowed?
tr: Arabasını ödünç aldığın adamın adı ne?

en: I think it is dangerous for you to drive a car.
tr: Araba kullanmanın senin için tehlikeli olduğunu düşünüyorum.

en: It's your turn to answer the question.
The reason for your failure is that you did not try hard enough.
I was afraid that you had failed.
It is necessary for you to think about your life.
Do it yourself.
She will be glad if you go to see her in person.
If you can read the following, we can communicate in Japanese, too.
tr: Eğer aşağıdakileri okuyabilirsen, Japonca da anlaşabiliriz.

en: That you will pass the exam is certain.
I am pleased that you have passed the exam.
I'm relying on you to help us.
tr: Bize yardım etmen için sana güveniyorum.

en: Everyone will be happy if you help us.
tr: Bize yardım edersen herkes mutlu olur.

en: I am glad to help you whenever you need me.
tr: İhtiyacın olduğunda sana her zaman yardım etmekten sevinirim.

en: I will accept the work, provided that you help me.
tr: Yardım etmen şartıyla işi kabul ederim.

en: Do you want me to wait until you come for me?
tr: Beni almaya gelene kadar beklememi ister misin?

en: You scratch my back and I'll scratch yours.
tr: Sen bana iyilik yap, ben de sana yaparım.

en: The problem has arisen simply because you didn't follow my instructions.
tr: Sorun, sadece benim talimatlarıma uymadığın için ortaya çıktı.

en: I am very grateful to you for what you've done for my family.
tr: Ailem için yaptıkların için sana çok teşekkür ederim.

en: I do not expect you to subscribe to my opinion.
Pretend you're me.
I'm glad you like my present.
Either you or I should visit her.
tr: Ya sen ya da ben onu ziyaret etmeliyiz.

en: Either you or I will have to go.
tr: Ya sen ya da ben gitmek zorunda kalacağız.

en: Either you or I will get the first prize.
tr: Ya sen ya da ben birincilik ödülünü alacağız.

en: Either you or I will have to do it.
tr: Ya sen ya da ben bunu yapmak zorunda kalacağız.

en: Either you or I must attend the meeting.
tr: Ya sen ya da ben toplantıya katılmalıyız.

en: I know nothing about him beyond what you told me.
tr: Bana söylediklerin dışında onun hakkında hiçbir şey bilmiyorum.

en: It is kind of you to talk about it for me.
tr: Benim için bu konuyu konuşman ne iyi oldu.

en: The magazine which you lent me is very interesting.
tr: Bana ödünç verdiğin dergi çok ilginç.

en: As you treat me, so will I treat you.
tr: Sen bana nasıl davranırsan, ben de sana öyle davranırım.

en: Tell me what you want me to do.
I'll do whatever you want me to do.
It is kind of you to lend me the money.
tr: Bana para verdiğin için çok naziksin.

en: Either you or I am in the wrong.
tr: Ya sen haksızsın ya da ben.

en: We have no objection to your joining us in our club.
Either you or I am right.
tr: Ya sen haklısın ya da ben.

en: I remember you often went to Betty's house to tea when you were a little girl.
tr: Küçük kızken sık sık Betty'ye çaya gittiğini hatırlıyorum.

en: When was it that you first met her?
Dinner will be ready by the time you have finished your work.
tr: Sen işini bitirince akşam yemeği hazır olur.

en: I'll recommend him as chairman, whether you are in favour of it or not.
tr: Sen istesen de istemesen de onu başkan olarak önereceğim.

en: Whether you agree or not, I cannot change my mind.
tr: Sen katılsan da katılmasan da fikrimi değiştiremem.

en: I'll sweep the floor while you wash the dishes.
tr: Sen bulaşıkları yıkarken ben yeri süpüreceğim.

en: Will you show me what you bought yesterday?
The man you saw in my office yesterday is from Belgium.
The man that you saw there yesterday was Mr Brown.
tr: Dün orada gördüğün adam Bay Brown'dı.

en: Let me read the paper when you have finished with it.
tr: Sen işin bitince gazeteyi ben okuyayım.

en: Here's a comfortable chair you can sit in.
If you are tied up now, I'll call you back later on.
I want to know what you did this summer.
tr: Bu yaz ne yaptığını öğrenmek istiyorum.

en: It seems hard for you to see him today.
tr: Bugün onu görmen zor olacak gibi.

en: What you have just said reminds me of an old saying.
tr: Az önce söylediklerin bana eski bir atasözünü hatırlattı.

en: If you leave now, I'm sure you'll be caught in a traffic jam.
What is it that you want me to do now?
Who has made you what you are now?
I'll miss you when you're gone.
It makes no difference to me whether you go or not.
tr: Gitsen de gitmesen de benim için fark etmez.

en: It's all the same to me whether you go or stay.
tr: Gitsen de kalsan da benim için fark etmez.

en: If you don't want to go, you don't need to.
We regret that you have to leave.
If you don't go, I will not go either.
You may invite whoever you like.
I do love you.
She said 'I love you' to me.
As you are sorry, I'll forgive you.
He will come if you call him.
I am feeling quite pleased about what you've said.
What you said was in the main right.
You say "ditto", and that's not the same as "I love you".
tr: Sen 'ditto' diyorsun, bu 'seni seviyorum' demekle aynı şey değil.

en: I know you are clever.
I can't study with you watching me.
It's quite natural that you should think about marriage.
When you get married and have kids, you'll realize that actions speak louder than words.
tr: Evlenip çoluk çocuğa karışınca, lafların değil yaptıkların önemli olduğunu anlayacaksın.

en: It makes no difference to me whether you are rich or poor.
tr: Zengin olsan da fakir olsan da benim için fark etmez.

en: I really look forward to your visit in the near future.
tr: Yakın zamanda yapacağın ziyareti sabırsızlıkla bekliyorum.

en: If you don't do your duty, people will look down on you.
tr: Görevini yapmazsan, insanlar sana tepeden bakarlar.

en: What you were taught is wrong.
I received great benefit from your teaching.
I understand you are going to spend your vacation in New Zealand.
The artist whose paintings you liked is a friend of mine.
There is one important fact of which you are unaware.
What was your mother doing when you returned home?
By the time you get home, all the cherry blossoms will have fallen.
tr: Sen eve varana kadar, tüm kiraz çiçekleri dökülmüş olur.

en: I'll be in bed by the time you get home.
tr: Sen eve varana kadar ben yatakta olurum.

en: There are a few points where you are mistaken.
Tell me the reason why you were late for school.
This letter arrived while you were out.
We often hear you sing.
Please look through these papers at your leisure.
tr: Müsait olduğunda bu kağıtlara bir göz at lütfen.

en: I found your coat after you left the house.
tr: Sen evden çıktıktan sonra paltunu buldum.

en: Whatever you say will set her off crying.
No matter what you say, I am convinced that I am right.
tr: Ne dersen de, haklı olduğuma eminim.

en: I can't make out what you are trying to say.
Tell me what you mean.
I know what your game is.
Tell me what you are looking forward to.
No matter what you may say, I will not change my mind.
I will lend you any book that I have, so long as you keep it clean.
tr: Temiz tuttuğun sürece, bende olan her kitabı sana ödünç veririm.

en: With your help, our plan would succeed.
It will be hard for you to speak English.
English will take you a long time to master.
The thing that you are intending to carry does not need to be carried.
Pick out the shirt that you like best.
Who is your favourite TV star?
I cannot consent to your going alone.
Let me put it in plain language you can understand.
It is dangerous for you to travel to a foreign country by yourself.
tr: Yabancı bir ülkeye yalnız başına gitmen tehlikeli.

en: It will be late autumn when you get to London.
I want to split up, but I know I couldn't even if I tried.
tr: Ayrılmak istiyorum ama denesem de yapamayacağımı biliyorum.

en: I've been looking forward to hearing from you for weeks.
I have got a letter from you.
I found your letter in the mailbox.
I can't seem to find your last e-mail, I wonder if you can resend it to me.
tr: Son e-postanı bulamıyorum, bana tekrar yollar mısın acaba?

en: You don't have to cancel your vacation.

tr: Bana başka bir soru sormaya cesaretin var mı?

en: I will not presume to give an opinion.
I make a special point of avoiding that shop.

en: I love the outdoors, but I hate bugs.

en: Einstein was a mathematical genius.

Einstein's theories contributed greatly to modern science.

en: Einstein's theory of relativity is Greek to me.

en: Such scientists as Einstein are rare.
Theoretical physics was child's play to Einstein, but he couldn't figure out his income tax.

en: We associate Einstein with the theory of relativity.
We associate the name of Einstein with the theory of relativity.
Einstein has been dead for nearly forty years.
I'm hopeless at ironing so I buy permanent press clothes.

en: I burned my hand with an iron.
The Irishman replies.

en: We should put out a call for bids.
I'm afraid the line is busy.
I'm sorry, my father is out.
I'm sorry my father is out.
I'm afraid we don't have any left.

en: Unfortunately, it rained yesterday.

en: Unfortunately, it rained.

en: Sorry, but he is out now.
I'm sorry, today is fully booked.

en: Unfortunately, I missed seeing the movie.
I'm afraid I can't accept your invitation.
I regret to say that the product you have asked for is currently out of stock.
tr: Üzgünüm, istediğiniz ürün şu an stokta yok.

en: As it happens, she is absent.
As it happened, I left my homework at home.
I'm sorry, your line is busy.
At the pop star's concert the fans were swarming around the foot of the stage.
tr: Pop yıldızının konserinde hayranlar sahnenin eteklerinde toplanmıştı.

en: Accepting the other's norms is submitting to the other's power.
tr: Başkasının normlarını kabul etmek, onun gücüne boyun eğmektir.

en: Ai and Mariko are close friends. They go everywhere together.
tr: Ai ve Mariko yakın arkadaşlar. Her yere birlikte giderler.

en: There is no shortage of ideas.
He shot at me.
I wouldn't push him too far. You don't know what he might do. I'd say you can't be too careful. They say even a doomed mouse will bite a cat if he has no choice.
tr: Onu fazla zorlama bence. Ne yapacağı belli olmaz. Hatta ne kadar dikkatli olsan azdır derim. Ne de olsa sıkışan fare bile kediye saldırır derler.

en: He's a different person when he's drunk, so I don't like to drink with him.
tr: Sarhoşken bambaşka birine dönüşüyor, bu yüzden onunla içki içmeyi sevmiyorum.

en: He shall die.
I will give him trouble.
He gives me chills.
They passed out.
The sight of him is hateful to me.
What fools they are!
I don't think they've fully adapted to the working world yet. They still seem like students.
tr: Henüz iş hayatına tam ayak uyduramadıklarını düşünüyorum. Hala öğrenci gibiler.

en: They are out of hand.
He's not a very meticulous guy.
I'll take my revenge on him at all costs tomorrow.
tr: Yarın ondan ne olursa olsun intikamımı alacağım.

en: Bastard hung up on me.
He's likely to be late so you'd better tell him again that the meeting time is seven to make double sure.
tr: Büyük ihtimalle geç kalır, o yüzden toplantı saatinin yedi olduğunu ona bir kez daha söylesen iyi olur, iyice emin olalım diye.

en: He is a wolf in sheep's clothing.
tr: O kuzu postuna bürünmüş bir kurt.

en: She got tired of his waffling and dumped him.
tr: Onun laf gevelemesinden sıkıldı ve onu terk etti.

en: He is really a perfect idiot.
He is a daredevil.
He's got money to burn.
He is too dumb to fear danger.
He is no better than a thief.
He is a shame of the town.
That fellow is a thorough fool.
Oh, he eats like a bird.
That fellow can't tell right from wrong.
He was the cock of the walk.
He is a formidable opponent.
He is a spoiled child.
Watch out for him. That guy can really hold a grudge.
tr: Ona dikkat et. O adam çok kin tutar.

en: He is so heartless.
He is a poet or something.
They say fine words are no virtue if they're insincere and that's him in a nutshell. He's all talk but doesn't mean a word of it.
tr: Sözün samimi olmayınca kıymeti olmaz derler, o da tam öyle. Sadece laf kalabalığı, dediklerinin hiçbirine inanmaz.

en: He has a sharp tongue.
He has a smooth tongue.
Don't tell him. He's got a loose tongue.
He is nasty.
He is a tough customer.
He has more lives than a cat.
All those tricks he's got up his sleeve make him a formidable client.
tr: Bütün o numaralarıyla o, dişli bir müşteri.

en: He is a self-willed fellow.
He has an evil countenance.
He should have worked harder.
He is a hard boiled egg.
What an oddball he is!
He is busy loafing on the job.
He is no ordinary man.
He is very mercenary.
That fellow is a cool hand.
That man is notorious as a gambler.
He is the dumbest kid in the class.
He's a car nut. Ask him anything.

en: That guy is always asking his parents for money.
tr: Şu çocuk sürekli ailesinden para dileniyor.

en: He is complaining about something or other all the time.

en: Who the devil was that?
He's a big show-off when girls are around.
tr: Kızlar olunca tam bir artist kesilir o.

en: That guy really burns me up.
He is a good joker.
Finally, he lost his temper.
He's a goner.
I find just the memory of his overly polite patronizing manner really offensive.
tr: Onun o sırnaşık kibar, tepeden bakan hallerini hatırlamak bile midemi bulandırıyor.

en: His talk bores me to death.
I gave him a stern talking to.
His little sister is very cute, isn't she?
tr: Küçük kız kardeşi çok tatlı, değil mi?

en: It constantly appalls me how stupid he can be.
tr: Ne kadar salak olabildiğine akıl sır erdiremiyorum.

en: I'll put his courage to the test.
He is a jack-of-all-trades.
I have to cover his loss.
I'll kill him.
I don't like his smart way of talking.
tr: Onun o bilmiş bilmiş konuşma tarzını hiç sevmem.

en: I have had quite enough of his jokes.
tr: Onun şakalarından gına geldi artık bana.

en: I don't live in his pocket.
You don't have to listen to what he says.
tr: Onun dediklerine kulak asmak zorunda değilsin.

en: Don't take any notice of what he says.
Nobody likes him, because he is always blowing his own horn.
tr: Kimse onu sevmez, çünkü sürekli kendini över.

en: I'll bewitch him into a frog!
You can trust him with any job.
tr: Ona her işi gözün kapalı emanet edebilirsin.

en: He made up a pretext for a fight with me.
tr: Benimle kavga etmek için bahane uydurdu.

en: I was deceived by him.
I'm up to here with him!
I can't abide that fellow.
I don't know what to do with that guy. No matter how mad I get at him he just takes it in stride and pays no attention.
tr: O adama ne yapacağımı bilmiyorum. Ne kadar kızsam da ona vız geliyor.

en: Anyone who criticizes him is asking for trouble.
tr: Onu eleştirmeye kalkan başına bela arar.

en: I absolutely will not speak to that fellow again!
tr: O herifle bir daha tek kelime etmem!

en: I've done with him for the future.
I don't get along with that guy.
I wonder where he is hiding.
He's always talking like a big shot, but it won't be long before all his faults are exposed.
tr: Hep atıp tutar ama çok geçmeden bütün foyası meydana çıkar.

en: He lives a freewheeling life. I think he ought to settle down a little.
tr: Başıboş bir hayat yaşıyor. Bence biraz durulmalı.

en: He called me a stupid boy.
You're crazy if you think he's on the up-and-up. The only reason you can say that is because you don't know what he's doing behind the scenes.
tr: Onun dürüst olduğunu düşünüyorsan aklını kaçırmışsın. Böyle demenin tek nedeni, perde arkasında ne çevirdiğini bilmemen.

en: He looks suspicious.
He stole my purse from me.
I don't care what they say.
He hurled defiance at me.
The idea that he is going to make a speech is laughable.
He buggered it up.

en: That man is a wet blanket.
tr: O adam tam bir keyif kaçıran.

en: He is buttering up to his boss.

Ice hockey is an exciting sport.

en: It is still as cold as ever.

en: Ah, you're leaving tomorrow!
Look! There's a plane taking off.
Ah, me!
Now I remember.
How awful!

en: How glad I am!
Well, here we are at last.
Wow, we're finally in Paris. Where should we visit first?

en: Armstrong was the first man to reach the moon.
Ah, I've failed again!

en: Arnold is concerned with cases of dual personality.
Arnie, can you hold on until help comes?

en: Oh, yes, I remember.
Archie made a move on her.

en: A beautiful object like that never loses its value.

en: Am I hungry!

en: It would be better for you to stay away from such a man.

en: Break off with such a man as that.
I felt utterly out of place among those sophisticated people.

en: A politician like that gets my goat.
A man like that gets on my nerves.

en: That kind of behaviour affects your honour.

en: Sofas like that don't come cheap.

en: Oh man! I was sure this was going to work out.
Oh, the toast is burned black.
The long rain makes me sick.
Oh, the train is being delayed.
Yes. She used to be a very shy girl.

en: Oh, have you?

en: How I wish I could go, too!
Oh, what a scare!
Alas, she died young.
Ah, when will they meet again?

Yeah, I've had it forever.

I wish I were a bird.

Oh, is that the way you milk a cow?
Oh, don't worry about it.

Oh! how awful!
